intro: Erythrochaete palmatifida, commonly known as the broadleaf erythrochaete, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps.
